title: (x) Humanist italic sans with rounded lower case "e" - Myriad {Stephen}
content:
Hi guys.

This unknown font is a sans serif with a rounded lower case "e" that seems out of place in the small sample I have for identification. The other characters are more typically angular. A newer design from the last eight years?

Thanks,  
John

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [15more.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805130641/http:/typophile.com/files/15more.jpg) | 58.32 KB |
author: sullivanj

comments.content: [Myriad Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140805130641/http:/store.adobe.com/type/browser/F/MYRP/F_MYRP-10012300.html). The 'e' doesn't look out of place once you see the who character set.

Thank you Stephen.  
Much appreciated,  
John S
Hmmm. This was not my ID.

I meant that I shouldn't have gotten the credit.

I actually can't see the graphic at all.

Hey, you should be glad to get free extra points! :^D Joking aside, thanks for pointing it out -- perpetual work mode is taking its toll.

On the other hand, this is I believe my third credit mistake in as many years... not _too_ bad. :^P
